titleStmt.title: Minors no senators. Or A briefe discourse, proving, that infants under the age of 21. yeares, are uncapable, in point of law, of being members of Parliament, and that the elections of any such are meere nullities; yea, injurious, prejuditiall, dishonourable to the whole Parliament and Kingdome, in sundry respects. / Written by a common-lawyer (a true lover of his country, and honourer of the Parliament) to a friend and client of his, for his private satisfaction, and published for the common-good.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

notesStmt.note: Singed at end: W.P., i.e. William Prynne.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
